poem:
"The Fringe Commediennes"

Among church walls, hallowed,
Amy-Lea teem with dreams.
In the babble of childhood's folly
we find humor, shaping an act.

Chiming innocence weaves into laughter,
two nannies churn, not of necessity,
but of purpose, aimed at stages
beyond the wealthy north's nursery.

The Edinburgh fringe calls- softly,
surely- as coddles sway to the rhythm
of their burgeoning bravado.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nanny review – light comedy about the dreams and day jobs of a double act A comedy double act since their university days and now working as nannies, Lea and Amy dream of success at the Edinburgh fringe. This year will surely bring their big break. With the festival fast approaching, they prepare the act during a weekly “stay and play” session in a church hall as they nanny the coddled offspring of wealthy north". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
